title: Invalid read of size 1 in exit

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
In both stable and nightly (as of today), an empty Rust program (`fn main() {}`) will trigger the following error in valgrind:
```
==8423== Invalid read of size 1
==8423==    at 0x486C501: ??? (in /usr/lib/libdl-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x486CA16: ??? (in /usr/lib/libdl-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x4A2108A: __libc_freeres (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x482D1AE: _vgnU_freeres (vg_preloaded.c:77)
==8423==    by 0x48EF561: __run_exit_handlers (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x48EF58D: exit (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x48D9229: (below main) (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==  Address 0xc0 is not stack'd, malloc'd or (recently) free'd
==8423== 
==8423== 
==8423== Process terminating with default action of signal 11 (SIGSEGV): dumping core
==8423==  Access not within mapped region at address 0xC0
==8423==    at 0x486C501: ??? (in /usr/lib/libdl-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x486CA16: ??? (in /usr/lib/libdl-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x4A2108A: __libc_freeres (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x482D1AE: _vgnU_freeres (vg_preloaded.c:77)
==8423==    by 0x48EF561: __run_exit_handlers (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x48EF58D: exit (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==    by 0x48D9229: (below main) (in /usr/lib/libc-2.28.so)
==8423==  If you believe this happened as a result of a stack
==8423==  overflow in your program's main thread (unlikely but
==8423==  possible), you can try to increase the size of the
==8423==  main thread stack using the --main-stacksize= flag.
==8423==  The main thread stack size used in this run was 8388608.
```
On Linux x64 (ArchLinux).
Rust was installed with rustup.
Thanks to fix the issue.
